lead_paragraph: Pacman Jones can join the Dallas Cowboys for everything but the regular season — for now. Commissioner Roger Goodell said Monday that he would decide by Sept. 1 whether to end Jones’s suspension, which wiped out his 2007 season. Goodell told Jones “his continued participation in the N.F.L. depends on demonstrating that he can conduct himself in a lawful and reliable manner,” the league wrote in a statement. Jones could join the team on Tuesday for its next practice.
